Detailed Description

The brain class represents the logic processing unit. It subscribes to several sensors, obtaining input information. It uses the obtained information to publish events on different topics, in particular it notifies the hand that it should squeeze with a certain force.

Member Function Documentation

void Brain::grip ( float  force,
bool  open = false 
)
protected

Sends the correct command to the hand for closing or opening the handler at the specified force.

Parameters
forceThe amount of force (in newton) to apply
openTrue to open the hand, false otherwise (default: false)

Callback handler for seeing objects at a distance.

Callback handler for seeing objects at a distance. The see message from the eyes describes a distance in millimeters

Parameters
messageThe message send by the eyes

Definition at line 20 of file Brain.cpp.

void Brain::spin ( )
virtual

Reads input from the user to obtain the amount of force they want to close the hand with. After the user enters this information, this method waits until an object was close enough for the hand to close. Afterwards this function resets, allowing the user to enter a new force.

Reimplemented from Node.

Definition at line 33 of file Brain.cpp.
